title: How to Activate T Mobile Voice Mail

steps.title: Press and hold the "1" key on your T-Mobile phone.
steps.content: Press and hold the "1" key on your T-Mobile phone. This will automatically dial the voicemail number for your account. If this method does not work, you can also dial "123" from your handset to access the voicemail servers.

steps.title: Enter your security code when prompted.
steps.content: Enter your security code when prompted. By default, the password is set to the last four digits of your mobile number.

steps.title: Enter a new security code for your voicemail when prompted.
steps.content: Enter a new security code for your voicemail when prompted. The security code can be 4-7 digits long. You will need to enter this code any time you call your voicemail, so make sure it is memorable. You can also disable the security code prompt when you call your voicemail from your phone by dialing #PWO# (#796#), and pressing send.

steps.title: Record your personal voicemail greeting when prompted.
steps.content: Record your personal voicemail greeting when prompted. Your personal greeting is what the caller hears when they are sent to your voicemail. Press “#” when you are finished recording and it will be played back for you to for confirmation. If you want, you can also opt to skip this step and use a standard greeting

steps.title: Test your voicemail.
steps.content: Test your voicemail. Make a test call to your number from another cell phone or landline phone to determine if you have successfully activated your T-Mobile voicemail.

steps.title: Press and hold the “1” key on your mobile phone.
steps.content: Press and hold the “1” key on your mobile phone. You will automatically be connected to your voicemail.

steps.title: Press the “*” key at the main menu.
steps.content: Press the “*” key at the main menu. This will take you to a list of mailbox settings.

steps.title: Press the “3” key.
steps.content: Press the “3” key. This will take you to Greetings menu.

steps.title: Press the “2” key.
steps.content: Press the “2” key. This will allow you to record a new greeting. Your current greeting will play before you record your new one.

steps.title: Record your new greeting.
steps.content: Record your new greeting. Wait for the prompt to begin recording and then speak clearly into the microphone.

steps.title: Press “#” to finish recording.
steps.content: Press “#” to finish recording. Your new recording will playback for you. If you are unsatisfied, you can press “2” again to record a new one.

steps.title: Press “1” to confirm the new greeting.
steps.content: Press “1” to confirm the new greeting. Your greeting will be set and you will be taken back to the menu.

steps.title: Check your phone’s signal.
steps.content: Check your phone’s signal. Dialing voicemail requires cell signal like any other call. If reception is poor you may have trouble connecting to your mailbox.

steps.title: Test alternate voicemail contacts.
steps.content: Test alternate voicemail contacts. If you are having trouble connecting to your voicemail by pressing and holding “1”, you can also dial “123” or “1-805-637-7249”. If these methods work, but holding “1” does not, then your voicemail feature may have been set up incorrectly by T-Mobile and you should contact them for support.

steps.title: Dial “##004#” to reset call forwarding.
steps.content: Dial “##004#” to reset call forwarding. If you find that unanswered calls aren’t being redirected to your voicemail, you can enter this button combo and press “Send” to reset forwarding. Your phone may need to be reset for the changes to take effect.

steps.title: Delete text messages if you are not receiving voicemail notifications.
steps.content: Delete text messages if you are not receiving voicemail notifications. If text messaging is functioning and your phone is up to date, you can try to delete all of your text messages, then reset your phone. Leave a test voicemail to check that notifications are now working.
